joehung302 wrote:
>  > Are you doing 'fast checkpointing'?  If not, you might want to
> consider
>  > it particularly since you're crawling big.
> 
> Would regular checkpointing help the crawl in addition to be able to
> recovery? If that's the case I would consider doing fast checkpoint
> more often.
> 
> Is there a document where I can read on how to recover from fast
> checkpoint?
> 

See http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#checkpoint.


>  >
>  > Are you saying that under the checkpoint directory, there was no
>  > directory named bdbje-logs that we were filling with the *.jdb
> bdbje log
>  > content from the job state directory?  In future you might take a
>  > threaddump or two to get a clue as to where the crawler is stuck.
>  >
> 
> I'll send you the kill -3 thread dump offline. From the thread
> reports nothing got stuck.
> 

Thanks.



>  > So the 'Cursor has been closed' and the OOMEs (assuming the top
> listed
>  > SEVEREs are OOMEs) look to be fairly concurrent.  The 'Cursor'
> SEVERE
>  > happens 8 seconds or so before the first OOME (The bulk of the 8
> seconds
> 
> possible. I'm now using a machine that would give me -Xmx2000m with
> bloom. I am waiting to see if that would get me less bdbje errors.
>


What were you running w/ previous?
Thanks Joe,
St.Ack
